item.title: Uber 击败指控司机评级存在种族偏见的诉讼
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周一驳回了一项集体诉讼提案，该提案称优步公司（Uber Technologies）解雇乘客评分低的司机的政策具有种族歧视性质。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Monday tossed out a proposed class action claiming Uber Technologies' policy of terminating drivers with low passenger ratings is racially discriminatory.】

item.title: 韦格威生产商诺和诺德将斥资 41 亿美元加强美国生产
item.description: 肥胖症药物制造商诺和诺德公司周一表示，将斥资 41 亿美元在美国建造一座工厂，为其广受欢迎的减肥药 Wegovy 和糖尿病药物 Ozempic 生产注射笔。【原文：Obesity drug-maker Novo Nordisk will spend $4.1 billion to build a U.S. facility to fill injection pens for its hugely popular weight-loss treatment Wegovy and diabetes drug Ozempic, it said on Monday.】

item.title: AT&T 希望大科技公司向电信和宽带补贴基金缴费
item.description: AT&T 首席执行官约翰-斯坦基（John Stankey）周一表示，国会应授权联邦通信委员会要求大型科技公司向政府基金捐款，以补贴电信和宽带服务的使用。【原文：AT&T CEO John Stankey said on Monday that Congress should give the Federal Communications Commission the power to require Big Tech firms to contribute to a government fund that subsidizes access to telecom and broadband services.】

item.title: 美联储戴利：通胀不是唯一的风险，政策必须 "谨慎 "行事
item.description: 旧金山联储主席玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周一表示，美联储必须 "小心谨慎 "地完成控制通胀的工作，并指出失业率上升的风险越来越大。【原文：The Federal Reserve must "exhibit care" as it aims to finish the job of bringing inflation under control, San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said on Monday, noting that rising unemployment is increasingly a risk.】

item.title: Rite Aid 在 2 亿美元的 Elixir 销售纠纷中击败 MedImpact
item.description: MedImpact 公司试图收回与收购 Rite Aid 公司药房福利部门有关的约 2 亿美元，但因法官周一裁定其在收购 Elixir 公司时承担了该公司的债务而失败。【原文：MedImpact's attempt to recoup about $200 million related to its purchase of Rite Aid's pharmacy benefit unit failed after a judge ruled on Monday that it took on Elixir's debts when it bought the company.】

item.title: 汽车制造商要求美国机构重新考虑紧急制动规则
item.description: 一个代表主要汽车制造商的团体要求美国国家公路交通安全管理局重新考虑其新规定，即到 2029 年，几乎所有的新车和卡车都必须配备先进的自动紧急制动系统。【原文：A group representing major automakers asked the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration to reconsider its new rule requiring nearly all new cars and trucks by 2029 to have advanced automatic emergency braking systems.】

item.title: 美国劳动力成本上升有可能导致新液化天然气项目脱轨
item.description: 熟练劳动力的短缺和美国墨西哥湾沿岸工资强劲增长所带来的通货膨胀问题，正在给液化天然气（LNG）开发商带来压力，并推迟了一些项目的融资许可。【原文：A shortage of skilled labor and nagging inflation from strong wage growth on the U.S. Gulf Coast are pressuring liquefied natural gas (LNG) developers and delaying some projects from reaching a financial go-ahead.】

item.title: 空中客车公司削减交付目标并推迟生产目标
item.description: 空中客车公司周一将2024年的飞机总交付目标从800架左右下调至770架左右，并推迟了75架窄体飞机的达产目标。【原文：Airbus on Monday lowered its 2024 total delivery target to around 770 airplanes from around 800 and pushed back its target of reaching production of 75 narrow-body airplanes.】

item.title: 聚焦：电动汽车制造商 Rivian 简化生产、削减成本，力争首次盈利
item.description: 电动汽车制造商 Rivian 为削减成本并首次实现盈利，已从电池制造流程中移除 100 多个步骤，从车身车间移除 52 台设备，并从其旗舰 SUV 和皮卡的设计中移除 500 多个部件。【原文：Electric-vehicle maker Rivian's drive to cut costs and turn its first profit has removed over 100 steps from the battery-making process, 52 pieces of equipment from the body shop and over 500 parts from the design of its flagship SUVs and pickups.】

item.title: 白宫官员称，微软与 G42 的交易具有积极意义，因为它切断了与华为的联系
item.description: 一位白宫官员周一表示，微软向 G42 投资 15 亿美元的交易 "总体上是一个积极的发展"，因为它迫使这家总部位于阿拉伯联合酋长国的公司断绝了与中国华为的关系。【原文：A Microsoft deal to invest $1.5 billion in G42 is "generally a positive development" because it forced the United Arab Emirates-based company to sever ties to China's Huawei, a White House official said on Monday.】

item.title: 雪佛龙第二季度在墨西哥湾资产的生产受到影响
item.description: 雪佛龙（Chevron）周一表示，预计第二季度上游周转和停机将影响每天 65,000 桶油当量的生产，主要集中在哈萨克斯坦的 Tengizchevroil (TCO) 和墨西哥湾的几处资产。【原文：Chevron said on Monday it expects upstream turnarounds and downtime to impact 65,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day in production in the second quarter mostly at Tengizchevroil (TCO) in Kazakhstan and several Gulf of Mexico assets.】

item.title: 音乐唱片公司起诉人工智能公司 Suno 和 Udio 侵犯美国版权
item.description: 索尼音乐公司（Sony Music）、环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）和华纳唱片公司（Warner Records）等大型唱片公司周一起诉人工智能公司Suno和Udio，指控它们使用唱片公司的唱片来训练音乐生成人工智能系统，侵犯了大量版权。【原文：Major record labels Sony Music , Universal Music Group and Warner Records sued artificial intelligence companies Suno and Udio on Monday, accusing them of committing mass copyright infringement by using the labels' recordings to train music-generating AI systems.】

item.title: 加拿大考虑对中国电动汽车征收进口关税
item.description: 加拿大副总理克里斯蒂娅-弗里兰（Chrystia Freeland）周一表示，加拿大正在考虑是否对中国制造的电动汽车（EV）征收进口关税，并将就此征求公众意见。【原文：Canada is considering whether to impose import tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles (EVs) and will seek the public's opinion about the idea, Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Monday.】

item.title: Affirm Holdings 股价上涨，高盛将其评级上调至 "买入 "评级
item.description: 周一，Affirm Holdings 的股价上涨了 7%，结束了连续 6 天的跌势。高盛（Goldman Sachs）将其评级上调至 "买入"，并上调了目标股价，理由是该金融科技公司的承保业务与竞争对手相比具有竞争力，尽管增长较快，但 "信贷结果管理良好"。【原文：Shares in Affirm Holdings were up 7% on Monday snapping a 6-day losing streak after Goldman Sachs upgraded its rating to 'buy' and raised its price target citing the fintech company's competitive underwriting compared with rivals and "well managed credit outcomes" despite faster growth.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比仍在寻找通胀降温的数据 - CNBC
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）仍在期待通胀进一步降温，这也是为降息敞开大门的进程之一。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee is still looking for inflation to cool further as part of the process that would open the door to a rate cut.】

item.title: 美国最高法院受理 "Dewberry "商标纠纷案
item.description: 美国最高法院周一同意就弗吉尼亚州和佐治亚州两家房地产开发商之间关于 "Dewberry "名称权的 4,300 万美元纠纷作出裁决，该案探讨了法院何时可以将公司利润作为商标侵权的补救措施。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to decide a $43 million dispute between two real estate developers - one in Virginia and one in Georgia - over the rights to the "Dewberry" name in a case exploring when courts can award a company's profits as a remedy for trademark infringement.】

item.title: 摩根大通称花旗的 "生前遗嘱 "缺陷可控但令人分心
item.description: 摩根大通认为，花旗集团所谓的 "生前遗嘱"（其中详细说明了花旗集团在破产情况下如何解散）中存在的问题是可控的，但可能会给高管们带来困扰。【原文：The problems with Citigroup's so-called living will, which details how it would be unwound in the event of bankruptcy, are manageable but could be bothersome for its executives, according to J.P.Morgan.】

item.title: Riot Platforms 撤回对竞争对手 Bitfarms 的收购要约，寻求三个董事会席位
item.description: 比特币矿商 Riot Platforms 周一表示，它将撤回对 Bitfarms 的收购要约，并已提名三名董事进入竞争对手加密货币矿商的董事会。【原文：Bitcoin miner Riot Platforms said on Monday it was withdrawing its offer for Bitfarms and had nominated three directors to the board of rival crypto miner.】

item.title: 独家报道KKR 为新北美收购基金寻求 200 亿美元投资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR 正在为其最新的北美私募股权旗舰基金向投资者募集约 200 亿美元的资金，而这距离该公司推出规模相近的前一只基金已经过去了三年。【原文：KKR is seeking about $20 billion from investors for its latest flagship North America private equity fund, according to people familiar with the matter, three years after it launched its predecessor fund of similar size.】

item.title: Shopify 扩大其人工智能功能的使用范围，以吸引更多企业
item.description: Shopify 周一向更多用户提供了人工智能工具，包括 Sidekick 助手和图像生成功能，以提高其电子商务平台的吸引力并促进收入增长。【原文：Shopify made its artificial intelligence-powered tools, including the Sidekick assistant and image-generation feature, available to more users on Monday, in a bid to increase the appeal of its e-commerce platform and boost revenue growth.】

item.title: CDK 黑客攻击的波及范围扩大，更多美国汽车经销商受到攻击
item.description: 周一，在 CDK 恢复北美 15,000 多个零售点使用的系统时，更多的美国汽车经销商发现 CDK 的软件系统因网络攻击而中断。【原文：More U.S. auto dealers flagged a hit from an outage of CDK's software system due to a cyber attack on Monday as the company worked to restore systems used by over 15,000 retail locations across North America.】

item.title: 解说员：将网络出售给 KKR 后，意大利电信的下一步是什么？
item.description: 意大利电信公司（TIM）将于 7 月 1 日完成向美国基金 KKR 出售其国内固定电话接入网络的交易，这将使其成为欧洲主要国家中第一家与固定电话网络分道扬镳的电话公司。【原文：Telecom Italia (TIM) will finalise on July 1 the landmark sale of its fixed-line domestic access network to U.S. fund KKR , a deal that makes it the first phone incumbent in a major European country to part ways with its landline grid.】

item.title: 保诚报告称，美国女性的退休储蓄仅为男性的 1/3
item.description: 美国保德信金融公司（Prudential Financial）周一公布的一项调查显示，美国女性为退休储蓄的金额仅为男性的三分之一，这为女性退休人员带来了潜在的危机。【原文：Women in the U.S. have saved just a third of the amount that men have set aside for retirement, setting up a potential crisis among female retirees, according to a Prudential Financial survey released on Monday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，快时尚零售商 Shein 于 6 月初申请在伦敦上市
item.description: 两位消息人士称，Shein 已于 6 月初向英国市场监管机构秘密提交了可能在伦敦上市的文件，这家在线快速时尚零售商将继续推进今年全球最大的首次公开募股之一。【原文：Shein has confidentially filed papers with Britain's markets regulator in early June for a potential London listing, two sources said, as the online fast fashion retailer moves ahead with what could one of the largest IPOs globally this year.】

item.title: 瑞银收购瑞士信贷后，外国银行瞄准瑞士
item.description: 瑞士信贷银行去年被瑞银集团收购后逐渐淡出历史舞台，全球银行纷纷在瑞士扩张，以利用企业分散业务的愿望。【原文：As Credit Suisse fades into history following its takeover by UBS last year, global banks are expanding in Switzerland to take advantage of companies' desire to spread their business.】

item.title: 通胀数据和总统辩论成为焦点，期货价格涨跌互现
item.description: 本周伊始，美国股指期货涨跌不一，关键的通胀数据和其他经济数据将进一步揭示货币政策的前景，而第一场美国总统辩论也在关注之列。【原文：U.S. index futures were mixed at the start of a week marked with a crucial inflation print and other economic data that are poised to shed further light on the monetary policy outlook, with the first U.S. presidential debate also on the watch list.】

item.title: 澳大利亚葡萄酒业是欧盟产业在中国贸易争端中的一个令人担忧的案例研究
item.description: 行业高管表示，在中国关税的打击下，尽管澳大利亚葡萄酒业争相建立新市场、从其他地方采购葡萄并寻求政府帮助，但仍难以抵消出口下降的影响。【原文：Hit with Chinese tariffs, Australia's wine industry struggled to offset the impact of falling exports despite scrambling to build new markets, source grapes from elsewhere and seek government help, industry executives said.】

item.title: 早间竞标临近半年，跨大西洋分拆重新开启
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美联储梅斯特抵押贷款债券销售仍应是美联储的选择
item.description: 在即将于本月底退休之际，克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长洛雷塔-梅斯特（Loretta Mester）仍然认为，央行需要继续对积极出售抵押贷款债券持开放态度，这也是央行持续缩减资产负债表规模努力的一部分。【原文：As she heads toward retirement at the end of the month, Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Loretta Mester still believes the central bank needs to remain open to active sales of mortgage bonds as part of its ongoing efforts to reduce the size of its balance sheet.】

item.title: 压力测试后，预计美国大型银行将对股东派息持谨慎态度
item.description: 分析师表示，在本周美联储的健康检查中，美国大型贷款机构预计将表明它们有充足的资本来抵御任何新的动荡，但在经济和监管不确定的情况下，它们在投资者赔付方面将持保守态度。【原文：Big U.S. lenders are expected to show they have ample capital to weather any renewed turmoil during this week's Federal Reserve health checks, but will be conservative on investor payouts amid economic and regulatory uncertainties, analysts said.】
